```{r lightamp, fig.width=5, fig.height=5, eval=F, include=F}
# Import data from Marcelino et al. 2013
md <- read.csv("data/marcelino2013_fig2a.csv")
md$S.R <- md$density * cm2.m2 / CmolR.m2 * CmolS.cellS  # Convert units of symbiont density to CmolS/CmolR
md$A <- md$E + 1  # Convert "E"=excess light metric of Marcelino to "A"=amplification factor
# Plot data
plot(md$A ~ md$S.R, pch=c(21,23,22)[factor(md$spp)], bg=c("white", "black", "gray")[factor(md$spp)], 
     ylab="internal/external light", ylim=c(1,3.2),
     xlab="Symbiont density (CmolS/CmolR)",
     main="Light Amplification")
legend("topright", legend=levels(md$spp), pch=c(21,23,22), pt.bg=c("white", "black", "gray"), inset=0.02)
# Fit exponential decay model and plot fitted values
mod <- nls(A ~ x + y * exp(z * S.R), data=md, start=list(x=1, y=2, z=-3))
fit <- predict(mod, list(S.R=seq(0, 0.5, 0.01)))
lines(fit ~ seq(0, 0.5, 0.01))
# Get parameters of fit
formula(mod); coef(mod)
```

### Steady states values with default parameters (jCO2a=0.32)
```{r ss, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4}
# Set time and parameters
time <- seq(1,100,1)
defpars <- def_pars()  # Get default parameters

# Set values of L and N at which to get steady state values
at <- expand.grid(L=seq(from=0, to=60, length.out=11),
                  N=seq(from=0, to=4e-6, length.out=11))

# Run to steady state and plot results
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, pars=defpars, at=at)
plot_steady_states(ssdat)
```

With default parameters, steady state values of specific growth are higher than usually observed in corals (skeletal growth).

### Change kROS from 60 to 100
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=T, include=T}
pars <- defpars
pars$kROS <- 100
# Run to steady state and plot results
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, pars=pars, at=at)
plot_steady_states(ssdat)#
```

### Change kROS to 100 and b to 5
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=T, include=T}
pars <- defpars
pars$kROS <- 100
pars$b <- 5
# Run to steady state and plot results
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, pars=pars, at=at)
plot_steady_states(ssdat)#
```

### Take away recycling...
```{r ss2, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=F, include=F}
pars <- defpars
pars$sigmaCH <- 0
pars$sigmaCS <- 0
pars$sigmaNH <- 0
pars$sigmaNS <- 0
# Run to steady state and plot results
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, pars=pars, at=at)
plot_steady_states(ssdat)
```

Specific growth rates are reduced by a bit, and both growth and S:H do not increase as much in response in increasing DIN.

### Increase CO2 delivery rate (jCO2a=0.5)
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=F, include=F}
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, at=at,
                            pars=replace(defpars, "jCO2a", 0.5))
plot_steady_states(ssdat) 
```

CO~2~ limitation of photosynthesis is reduced, and S:H biomass does not increase as much in response to low light.

### Increase CO2 delivery rate even more (jCO2a=1)
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=F, include=F}
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, at=at,
                            pars=replace(defpars, "jCO2a", 1))
plot_steady_states(ssdat) 
```

Photosynthesis never becomes CO~2~-limited.

### Decrease CO2 delivery rate (jCO2a=0.1)
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=F, include=F}
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, at=at,
                            pars=replace(defpars, "jCO2a", 0.1))
plot_steady_states(ssdat) 
```

Photosynthesis is always CO~2~-limited, and host growth almost always carbon-limited. Upper light limit is reduced, and S:H biomass ratios are increased. 

### Decrease CO2 delivery rate even more (jCO2a=0.05)
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=F, include=F}
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, at=at,
                            pars=replace(defpars, "jCO2a", 0.05))
plot_steady_states(ssdat) 
```

Increasing DIN now decreases growth rates. S:H ratios are uniformly high.

### Default parameters with tolerant symbiont (kROS=100; jCPm=1.4)
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=F, include=F}
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, at=at,
                            pars=replace(defpars, c("kROS","jCPm"), c(100, 1.4)))
plot_steady_states(ssdat) 
```

### Default parameters with only lower photosynthesis rate (jCPm=1.4)
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=F, include=F}
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, at=at,
                            pars=replace(defpars, "jCPm", 1.4))
plot_steady_states(ssdat) 
```


### Default parameters with only lower photosynthesis rate (jCPm=2)
```{r, cache=T, fig.width=5, fig.height=4.4, eval=F, include=F}
ssdat <- run_steady_states(time=time, at=at,
                            pars=replace(defpars, "jCPm", 2))
plot_steady_states(ssdat) 
```




### Run 1
```{r run1}
# Set run time vector
time <- seq(1, 365, 0.5)  # if single model run, use time input

# Initialize environment
env <- init_env(time=time, L=c(5,40,2), N=c(1e-7,1e-7,0), X=c(0,0,0))

# Set parameters
defpars <- def_pars()  # Get default parameters

# Run simulation
run <- run_coral(time=time, env=env, pars=defpars)#
```

##### Plot run 1 symbiont PI curve
```{r run1_PI, cache=T, fig.height=3}
sym(pars=replace(defpars, c("kNPQ", "kROS", "k"), c(40, 30, 1)), jL=c(0,250), jCO2=c(100,100), NPQ="fixed")
```

##### Plot run 1 output
```{r abb, fig.height=8, fig.width=3, eval=T, include=T}
time <- seq(1,365,0.5)
env <- init_env(time=time, L=c(5,40,2), N=c(1e-7,1e-7,0), X=c(4e-6,4e-6,0))
run <- run_coral(time=time, env=env, 
                 pars=replace(defpars, c("kNPQ", "kROS", "k", "b", "jCO2a"), c(30, 10, 1, 5, 0.32)),
                 NPQ="fixed2", photoinhibition=T)
plot_run2(run)
env <- init_env(time=time, L=c(10,40,2), N=c(1e-7,1e-7,0), X=c(4e-6,4e-6,0))
run <- run_coral_jCO2a(time=time, env=env,
                 pars=replace(defpars, c("kNPQ", "kROS", "k", "b"), c(80, 80, 1, 10)),
                 NPQ="fixed2")
run$H$jCO2a
run$S$jCP * run$S$S / run$H$H
plot_run2(run)

env <- init_env(time=time, L=c(40,40,0), N=c(1e-7,1e-7,0), X=c(5e-5,5e-5,0))
run <- run_coral_jCO2a_manual(time=time, env=env, jCO2a_vals=c(3,1),
                 pars=replace(defpars, 
                              c("kNPQ", "kROS", "k", "b", "sigmaCS", "sigmaCH"), 
                              c(60,       40,    1,   5,      0,         0)),
                 NPQ="fixed2")
plot_run2(run)



##### VARY NITROGEN
# RUN USING WASTED CARBON AND NO JCO2A
time <- seq(1,1230,1)
env <- init_env(time=time, L=c(15,15,2), N=c(1e-7,1e-6,2), X=c(5e-6,5e-6,0))
run <- run_coral_wC(time=time, env=env,
                 pars=replace(defpars, 
                              c("kNPQ", "kROS", "k", "b", "sigmaCS", "sigmaCH", "jCO2a"), 
                              c(40,       30,    1,   5,      0.9,         0.9, 0)),
                 NPQ="fixed2")
plot_run(run)

# RUN USING JCO2A (original version of model)
run <- run_coral(time=time, env=env,
                 pars=replace(defpars, 
                              c("kNPQ", "kROS", "k", "b", "sigmaCS", "sigmaCH", "jCO2a"), 
                              c(40,       30,    1,   5,      0.9,         0.9, 0.32)),
                 NPQ="fixed2")
plot_run(run)
```

##### Run 3 -- fluctuate light with higher DIN
```{r run3_plot, fig.height=3, fig.width=3, eval=T, include=T}
# Set run time vector
#time <- seq(1, 365, 0.5)  # if single model run, use time input

# Initialize environment
env <- init_env(time=time, L=c(2,40,2), N=c(4e-6,4e-6,0), X=c(0,0,0))

# Run simulation
run3 <- run_coral(time=time, env=env, pars=defpars)
par(mar=c(2,2,1,1), oma=c(0,0,0,0), mfrow=c(2,1), mgp=c(1,0,0), tck=0.025, lwd=1, xaxs="i", 
    cex.main=1.2, cex.axis=1, cex.lab=1)
plot_sh(run)  # run 1 -- lower DIN
plot_sh(run3)  # run3 -- higher DIN

```

